concise_definition: aux. (did not 的缩写) 没有

definitions.explanation_en: The contracted form of 'did not', used to form the negative of the simple past tense of verbs, especially with the base form of the main verb.
definitions.explanation_cn: 是 'did not' 的缩写形式，用于构成动词一般过去时的否定形式，后接动词原形。
definitions.example_en: She didn't finish her homework last night.

definitions.explanation_en: Used in questions and negative statements to emphasize the absence of an action or event in the past.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于疑问句和否定句中，强调过去某个动作或事件并未发生。
definitions.example_en: Didn't you say you were coming to the party?
definitions.example_cn: 你不是说你要来参加派对的吗？

comparison.analysis: “Haven't” (have not 的缩写) 用于构成现在完成时的否定形式，强调动作与现在的关联或影响。而 “didn't” 仅用于一般过去时，表示过去某个时间点发生的动作未发生，与现在无直接联系。例如：I haven't eaten (到现在还没吃) vs. I didn't eat (昨晚没吃)。
“Doesn't” (does not 的缩写) 用于第三人称单数的一般现在时否定句，而 “didn't” 用于所有主语的一般过去时否定句。两者时态不同：He doesn't like coffee (现在不喜欢) vs. He didn't like coffee (过去不喜欢)。
“Wasn't” (was not 的缩写) 是 be 动词 was 的否定形式，用于描述过去的状态、身份或特征，而 “didn't” 用于否定过去的行为或动作。例如：He wasn't happy (他当时不开心) vs. He didn't smile (他没有笑)。前者是状态，后者是动作。
